title: How to Make Mushroom Cutlets

steps.headline: Peel and cut up the mushrooms and chop up the onion.
steps.description: Fry them in 1 oz. of butter till partially cooked.

steps.headline: Mix the mushrooms and onion with the mashed potatoes, breadcrumbs, the herbs/parsley and one well beaten egg.
steps.description: Add pepper and salt to taste; if necessary add a little milk to soften the mixture, if it seems too dry.

steps.headline: Shape the mixture into cutlets.
Dip them in the remaining well beaten egg, and fry them in the rest of the butter.
steps.description: Turn them over to brown evenly.

steps.headline: Serve with tomato sauce and salad or steamed vegetables.
Add a teaspoon of oil to the frying pan or skillet.
Add the onions, green chile and garlic.
Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Add the cooked vegetables, potato cubes, chopped mushrooms, turmeric and chile powders and garam masala. Add salt to taste.

steps.headline: Let cool.
steps.description: Add the egg whites and mash everything together.

steps.headline: Shape into small patties.
steps.description: Roll into a ball, then squash to flatten. Press over breadcrumbs to coat both sides.

steps.headline: Add oil to the pan for frying.
Add to the pan and fry.
steps.description: Flip over when it is golden brown.

steps.headline: Drain excess oil on paper towel if needed.
steps.description: The mushroom cutlets are now ready to serve. Serve with sauce, chutney or ketchup.

steps.headline: Heat olive oil in a frying pan or skillet.
Add the crushed garlic and chopped onions.
Add the mushrooms.
Remove from the heat when the mushrooms have released their liquid.
steps.description: Add the green peas and mashed potatoes and stir. The potato will soak up the liquid.

steps.headline: Add the cinnamon, sugar and dried parsley.
steps.description: Season with salt and freshly ground pepper. Mix everything together.

steps.headline: Heat the mixture again for a while.
steps.description: The heating helps to hold the mixture together.

steps.headline: Form a ball from the mixture.
steps.description: If it sticks together, it has been heated for long enough. Shape the mixture into patties.

steps.headline: Make an egg wash.
steps.description: Mix egg and water at a 1 to 1 ration in a small wide bowl. Dip each patty into the egg wash, then coat in breadcrumbs. Let stand for 5 minutes before frying.

steps.headline: Heat the oil in a frying pan or skillet.
steps.description: Add cutlets in batches (3-4 at a time) and cook until golden brown on both sides. Keep warm in a warm oven until serving time.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Arrange on plates with steamed vegetables, rice, quinoa or other accompaniments.

steps.headline: Finished.

text: Mushroom potato cutlets Peel and cut up the mushrooms and chop up the onion. Fry them in 1 oz. of butter till partially cooked. Mix the mushrooms and onion with the mashed potatoes, breadcrumbs, the herbs/parsley and one well beaten egg. Add pepper and salt to taste; if necessary add a little milk to soften the mixture, if it seems too dry. Shape the mixture into cutlets.  Dip them in the remaining well beaten egg, and fry them in the rest of the butter. Turn them over to brown evenly. Serve with tomato sauce and salad or steamed vegetables.  Mushroom vegetable cutlets Add a teaspoon of oil to the frying pan or skillet.  Add the onions, green chile and garlic. Cook until slightly browned. Remove from the heat. Add the cooked vegetables, potato cubes, chopped mushrooms, turmeric and chile powders and garam masala. Add salt to taste. Let cool. Add the egg whites and mash everything together. Shape into small patties. Roll into a ball, then squash to flatten. Press over breadcrumbs to coat both sides. Add oil to the pan for frying. Heat over medium heat. Add to the pan and fry. Flip over when it is golden brown. Drain excess oil on paper towel if needed. The mushroom cutlets are now ready to serve. Serve with sauce, chutney or ketchup. Mushroom and pea cutlets Heat olive oil in a frying pan or skillet.  Add the crushed garlic and chopped onions. Cook until translucent. Add the mushrooms. Cook over high heat. Remove from the heat when the mushrooms have released their liquid. Add the green peas and mashed potatoes and stir. The potato will soak up the liquid. Add the cinnamon, sugar and dried parsley. Season with salt and freshly ground pepper. Mix everything together. Heat the mixture again for a while. The heating helps to hold the mixture together. Form a ball from the mixture. If it sticks together, it has been heated for long enough. Shape the mixture into patties. Make an egg wash. Mix egg and water at a 1 to 1 ration in a small wide bowl. Dip each patty into the egg wash, then coat in breadcrumbs. Let stand for 5 minutes before frying. Heat the oil in a frying pan or skillet. Add cutlets in batches (3-4 at a time) and cook until golden brown on both sides. Keep warm in a warm oven until serving time. Serve. Arrange on plates with steamed vegetables, rice, quinoa or other accompaniments. Finished.
